models.CPF module

class models.CPF.CPF(counts, vocab, num_topics, batch_size, X_design_matrix)[source]

Bases: NumpyroModel

Implementation of the standard Poisson factorization topic model including covariates.

return_covariate_effects()[source]

Return the covariate effects for the model.

Returns:

DataFrame containing the covariate effects with covariates as rows and topics as columns.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

models.CSPF module

class models.CSPF.CSPF(counts, vocab, keywords, residual_topics, batch_size, X_design_matrix)[source]

Bases: NumpyroModel

Implementation of the Seeded Poisson Factorization (SPF) topic model including covariates.

CSPF allows to fit a guided topic model and estimate covariate effects that drive topic polarization.

return_beta()[source]

Return the beta matrix for the model.

Returns:

DataFrame containing the beta matrix with words as rows and topics as columns.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

return_covariate_effects()[source]

Return the covariate effects for the model.

Returns:

DataFrame containing the covariate effects with covariates as rows and topics as columns.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

return_topics()[source]

Return the topics for each document.

Returns:

topicsnumpy.ndarray

Array of topic names for each document.

E_thetanumpy.ndarray

Estimated topic proportions for each document.

Return type:

tuple

models.PF module

class models.PF.PF(counts, vocab, num_topics, batch_size)[source]

Bases: NumpyroModel

Documentation of the Poisson factorization (PF) topic model. PF is an unsupervised topic model.

models.SPF module

class models.SPF.SPF(counts, vocab, keywords, residual_topics, batch_size)[source]

Bases: NumpyroModel

Implementation of the Seeded Poisson Factorization (SPF) topic model.

SPF allows to fit guided topics by increasing the topical prevalence of seed words a-priori.

return_beta()[source]

Return the beta matrix for the model, i.e. topic-word intensities. Reimplemented from the base class due to the higher rates approach for seed words.

Returns:

DataFrame containing the beta matrix with words as rows and topics as columns.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

return_topics()[source]

Return the topics for each document. Reimplemented from the base class due to the guided topic modeling approach, where topics are not fully unsupervised.

Returns:

topicsnumpy.ndarray

Array of recoded topics.

E_thetanumpy.ndarray

Estimated topic proportions for each document.

Return type:

tuple

models.TBIP module

class models.TBIP.TBIP(counts, vocab, num_topics, authors, batch_size)[source]

Bases: NumpyroModel

TBIP Model

This class models topic-based ideal points (TBIP) in a set of documents authored by multiple individuals.

train_step(num_steps: int, lr: float)[source]

Custom train function specified exclusively for TBIP objects.

Parameters:

  • num_steps (int) – Number of training steps.

  • lr (float) – Learning rate for the optimizer.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the estimated parameter values

Return type:

dict

models.numpyro_model module

class models.numpyro_model.NumpyroModel[source]

Bases: ABC

Abstract base class for all used probabilistic models. Each model has to implement at least their own Model and Guide.

Metrics = Metrics(loss=[])

Train the model using SVI.

  • lr (float) – Learning rate for the optimizer.
